SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

gr.forth.ics.swkm.model2.io
Class RdfIO

java.lang.Object
  gr.forth.ics.swkm.model2.io.RdfIO

public class RdfIO
extends Object

A class containing utilities for reading and writing RDF content in various serialization formats.

Reading

This class allows reading, using various serialization formats, from a File, a URL, a String, a Reader or an InputStream. In case of reading from a File or a URL, the method signatures allow the option of using a default base URI (derived from the File or the URL, respectively). In the rest of the cases, a base URI to be used must be specified. If the base URI is explicitly defined, it overrides any base URI declaration inlined in the input document.

During parsing, triples that are not explicitly defined in a named graph (in a Format-specific way, if such a way exists at all for a given serialization format), are put into the named graph given with the RdfIO.InputWithBase.withDefaultNamedGraph(Uri) method. If this method is not called, then the default named graph is assumed to be RdfSuite.DEFAULT_GRAPH_URI. Triples that have an explicitly defined named graph are only added to that one, not the default named graph.

Examples of reading

All the following examples assume the existence of a model variable of type Model.

Reading from an RDFXML file and putting the triples into a specific named graph of a model: RdfIO.read(new File("input.rdf"), Format.RDFXML).withBase("http://base#").withDefaultNamedGraph("http://myNamedGraph").into(model);

Writing

This class allows writing, using the contents of a Model to a File, to an OutputStream, to a Writer or to a String.

Examples of writing

All the following examples assume the existence of a model variable of type Model.

Writing an RDF/XML document to a File: 

RdfIO.write(model, Format.RDFXML).withBase("http://example.com/baseURI").toFile(new File("path/to/output/file.rdf");
Or without setting a base URI: 
RdfIO.write(model, Format.RDFXML).toFile(new File("path/to/output/file.rdf");

Writing a TriG document to an OutputStream: 

OutputStream out = ...;
RdfIO.write(model, Format.TRIG).withBase("http://example.com/baseURI").toStream(out);
Or without setting a base URI: 
RdfIO.write(model, Format.TRIG).toStream(out);

Writing a TRIX document to an Writer: 

Writer writer = ...;
RdfIO.write(model, Format.TRIX).withBase("http://example.com/baseURI").toStream(writer);
Or without setting a base URI: 
RdfIO.write(model, Format.TRIX).toStream(writer);

Writing a NTRIPLES document to a String: 

String string = RdfIO.write(model, Format.RDFXML).withBase("http://example.com/baseURI").toString();
Or without setting a base URI: 
String string = RdfIO.write(model, Format.RDFXML).toString();

All methods of this class throw NullPointerException for null arguments, unless otherwise specified.

Author:
Andreou Dimitris, email: jim.andreou (at) gmail (dot) com

Nested Class Summary
static class RdfIO.InputWithBase
          A class that performs the actual parsing and adds the produced triples to a model.

          A class that handles part of the workflow of a parsing; particularly the part that the user optionally specifies the base URI to be used.

                                          Format format)
Prepares a parsing of the specified InputStream, using the specified serialization format. The actual parsing happens later, using the returned object.

format - the serialization format to use
Returns:
